section.title: Element: FuncExpr
section.simpara: The FuncExpr element encapsulates the behavior of the Fe recursive stimuli in the Function Specification, which are values which return either operators or functions.

formalpara.title: FuncExpr contents
formalpara.para: The contents of a FuncExpr element follow some specific patterns based on the type of the function. These correspond to how the function expression is created.

formalpara.title: FuncExpr attributes
formalpara.para:
The attribute name works as it does for the Expression and the Function elements. The equiv attribute contains either the primitive function or operator to which the expression is equivalent, or it contains one of ambivalent, monadic, or dyadic. Which correspond to the three values and classes of user-defined functions and operators. The class attribute identifies the major classes of function expressions, and can be one of the following:
ambivalent monadic dyadic . This corresponds to the three large classes of function expressions without regard to the axis specification in the Function Specification.
